intro: Stillingia lineata var. densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower stillingia, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, oblong fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Papaveraceae family.
